g.H7651: seven (as the sacred full one); also (adverbially) seven times; by implication, a week; by extension, an indefinite number
g.H3967: a hundred; also as a multiplicative and a fraction
g.H376: a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
g.H8025: to pull out, up or off
g.H2719: drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
g.H1234: to cleave; generally, to rend, break, rip or open
g.H413: near, with or among; often in general, to
g.H123: Edom, the elder twin-brother of Jacob; hence the region (Idumaea) occupied by him
g.H3201: to be able, literally (can, could) or morally (may, might)
g.H3808: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

g.H3947: to take (in the widest variety of applications)
g.H853: properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
g.H1121: a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality ...
g.H834: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
g.H4427: to reign; inceptively, to ascend the throne; causatively, to induct into royalty; hence (by implication) to take counsel
g.H8478: the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
g.H5927: to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
g.H5930: a step or (collectively, stairs, as ascending); usually a holocaust (as going up in smoke)
g.H5921: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
g.H1961: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
g.H1419: great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
g.H7110: a splinter (as chipped off); figuratively, rage or strife
g.H3478: Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
g.H5265: properly, to pull up, especially the tent-pins, i.e. start on ajourney
g.H7725: to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point...
g.H776: the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
